full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement: Annual Servicing of Residential Housing Units at CFB Shilo, Manitoba
#### Solicitation No. HAYSL10_SC79494

#### Important Dates

* Publication Date: February 10, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: March 22, 2023, at 15:00:00
* Contract start date: Not specified
* Contract end date: Not specified

#### Contract Details

* Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is seeking a contractor to provide annual servicing of residential housing units at CFB Shilo, Manitoba.
* The work includes, but is not limited to, the supply of all labor, materials, equipment, supervision, overhead, profit, and other charges required to complete annual servicing at various DND Residential Housing Units (RHU) and apartment complexes.

#### Trade Agreements and Regions

* This procurement is being conducted in accordance with the requirements set out in Chapter Five of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Chapter Nineteen of the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (GPA).
* The contractor will be required to comply with all applicable trade agreements and regulations.

#### Submission Requirements

* Tenderers must submit their proposals electronically through MERX.
* Complete tender documents, including the instruction to tenderers, can be ordered from MERX on the website or by calling 1 (800) 964-MERX (6379).
* Tenderers must ensure they have obtained the latest amendments to the tender documents from MERX, as those obtained from other sources may not be current.

#### Evaluation and Disqualification

* The bidder list includes those who have ordered tender documents. Bidders whose names do not appear on the list may have their bids declared invalid.
* Bidders may be disqualified if they contact anyone other than the designated DCC Contracting Authority for clarification during the solicitation period.

#### Award and Contract Duration

* The contract will be in place from the notification of award until February 28, 2025. It may be extended for two additional one-year periods with the same terms and conditions and applicable cost escalation.
* The annual amount submitted for the first year will be adjusted at the two-year anniversary of the award based on the Bank of Canada's Consumer Price Index (CPI).

#### Contact Information

* For inquiries or clarification, please contact:
	+ Bradley Jeaurond, Contracting Authority
	+ Defence Construction Canada (DCC)
	+
